p: Scientists reported in one study how the spike-like glycoprotein of the SARS-CoV-2 virus binds to the ACE2 receptor. Accordingly, the presence of transmembrane protease serine2 (TMPRSS 2) is required for spike protein priming. The researchers found that Camostat mesylate , a serine protease inhibitor, could block the entry of SARS-CoV-2 into lung cells. So, it might be effective against COVID-19. However the application of this drug as a treatment for COVID-19 requires clinical trials [95].
